author: mikem
msg: DERBY-5284 A derby crash at exactly right time during a btree split can cause a
corrupt db which can not be booted.
backport fix from trunk to 10.4 branch. minor conflict resolution in merge.
Fixed a problem during BTREE split.  The first phase of btree split sees
if it can reclaim space from committed deleted rows.  If it finds any
it purges these rows in a nested internal transaction.  It needs to hold
the latch on the page until end of transaction, but did not.  This allowed
a very small window of a few instructions where another insert could use
the space on the page and then a system crash could cause the purges to undo
but fail due to the insert.
The fix was to hold the latch and let commit release it.

author: mfreedman
msg: Test changes merged forward from jsr329TCK that were result of fixing/addressing PORTLETBRIDGE-215

author: mfreedman
msg: Latest set of updates -- primarily cleaned up scope use/management (its now tied to the viewId) + fixed PORTLETBRIDGE-215 in this code line.

author: rhuijben
msg: Improve the error message on a denied commit operation a bit by handling
the error in a place where we know which node failed.
Pass the failure to the notification handler to allow third party applications
access to this information.
* subversion/include/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_CLIENT_NO_LOCK_TOKEN): Make the default error message a bit more
generic and make sure the error number is unique.
(SVN_ERR_CLIENT_FORBIDDEN): New error.
* subversion/include/svn_wc.h
(svn_wc_notify_action_t): Add svn_wc_notify_failed_forbidden value.
* subversion/libsvn_client/commit_util.c
(fixup_out_of_date_error): Handle dav forbidden errors.

author: jbellis
msg: r/m unhelpful advice to rebuild index file (because scrub does that implicitly)
